definition: to brush past
to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish

(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Unsurprisingly, the reaction he received from passers-by was one of complete  bewilderment.
sentences.chinese: 不出所料的是，當時與他擦身而過的人是多麼的困惑。

sentences.english: They pass quickly, sometimes never to return again.
sentences.chinese: 有些機會很快與我們擦身而過，更有時不會再有。

sentences.english: Unsurprisingly, the reaction he received from passers-by was one of complete bewilderment.
sentences.chinese: 不出所料的是，當時與他擦身而過的人是多麼的困惑。

sentences.english: He brushed by with a perfunctory wave to the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他擦身而過，朝人羣敷衍地揮了揮手。

sentences.english: A bicycle brushed past me in a very rude way.
sentences.chinese: 一輛自行車無禮地從我旁邊擦身而過。

sentences.english: He brushed straight by without even looking at me.
sentences.chinese: 他徑直擦身而過，甚至不看我一眼。

sentences.english: Jack brushed against her as he left the room.
sentences.chinese: 當傑克離開房間時，他從她旁邊擦身而過。

sentences.english: Sometimes I feel like I'm upside down, and all those dreams are fallin' right past me.
sentences.chinese: 有時我彷彿生活顛倒，所有的夢與我擦身而過。

sentences.english: Why thousands of the world's reincarnation, and I look forward to the moment of passing?
sentences.chinese: 爲何千世的輪迴裏，我總與盼望的時刻擦身而過？

sentences.english: I see, too, some laborer pushed up against you as you came along.
sentences.chinese: 我也知道，在你趕來時，有一位勞工與你擦身而過。

sentences.english: Don't miss these Golden Bears hidden in the Berkeley campus.
sentences.chinese: 漫步柏克萊校園中，你會和這些金熊們擦身而過。

sentences.english: Our biggest mistake, just at that moment the encounter, not passing.
sentences.chinese: 我們最大的錯，就是在相遇的那一刻，不擦身而過。
